content.description: Begin with a gentle slab start to a comfortable ledge rest, followed by more vertical climbing as the dihedral crack thins into the crux.  Careful footwork and body position will help you gain the second ledge to clip the anchors.  The dihedral provides some shade, which may be helpful in warmer weather.
content.location: The obvious dihedral at about the halfway point along the wall.

content.description: An excellent warm up or introductory outdoor lead, with a good mix of hold types and comfortable bolting. Begin left for an easier start; the direct start is a little more challenging but would not change the grade.
content.location: The leftmost route on the wall.

content.description: Direct start with a super fun bouldering move on good holds at the ground. The right variation (5.8) climbs the easier off the ground and joins at the 2nd bolt.
content.location: 15 Ft right of Green Dragon and left of Xylem.

content.description: Start on jugs then finish with some slabby moves up top.
content.location: Right of obvious longer Grape Vine route.

content.description: Another low crux then a cruise to the anchor. Could link with Grape Vine to the right for a longer route.
content.location: Just left of the tall Grape Vine route.

content.description: Fire off small crimps to a big ledge under the first bolt. Easy climbing to two big jugs to a bouldery slopey crux under the chains.
content.location: 3rd bolt line from the trail entrance

content.description: Work through a low crux through a series of small ledges. Finish in a small dihedral just before the anchor. Watch out for lots of loose rock.
content.location: Just right of Moonseed, obvious longer route on the wall.

content.description: Pull on good holds to gain the face.   The crux comes at the top ~10 feet before the anchors.
The route starts on the left side of the long drill mark with powerful moves low, leading to easier terrain above.
content.location: Located about 25 ft right of Xylem on the next prominent face.

content.description: Slight bouldery start to a nice ledge, then easy sustained climbing to the anchors. 7 quickdraws(5 bolts, 2 for the anchor).
content.protection: 5 Bolts and Anchors with rap rings
content.location: About 50 feet to the right of Pipistrelle look for the anchors high up on the bluff face. You’ll need to scramble up a brushy, blocky area to reach the high belay stance. Climb the quality, sustained moves on this amazing line gaining one of the highest points on the bluff to enjoy the view. You might even see the ski slopes at Hidden Valley Resort to the south.

content.description: Start on good holds that are far apart leading to a ledge with a tricky mantle. Stem through good, but slightly tricky moves at the 4th bolt.
Similar to Drill Bit, pull through powerful moves low to easier terrain above. Tread lightly on decent feet between the 2nd and 3rd bolt which requires a high clip.
content.location: Immediately next to Drill Bit, on the right side of the long drill mark, you’ll find Cobb Wright, the namesake of the site’s mining company from the 1800’s.

content.description: New crag opened fall 2021. currently 14 bolted lines with more development to come.
